para.sentence: If x\geq 1 , y\geq 1 , 2\pi xy=t , and 0\leq\sigma\leq 1 , then as t\to\infty with \sigma fixed, \zeta\left(\sigma+it\right)=\sum_{1\leq n\leq x}\frac{1}{n^{s}}+\chi(s)\sum_{1 \leq n\leq y}\frac{1}{n^{1-s}}+O\left(x^{-\sigma}\right)+O\left(y^{\sigma-1}t^ {\frac{1}{2}-\sigma}\right), where s=\sigma+it and \chi(s)=\pi^{s-\frac{1}{2}}\Gamma\left(\tfrac{1}{2}-\tfrac{1}{2}s\right)/ \Gamma\left(\tfrac{1}{2}s\right).

If \sigma=\frac{1}{2} , x=y=\sqrt{t/(2\pi)} , and m=\left\lfloor x\right\rfloor , then(25.9.1) becomes \zeta\left(\tfrac{1}{2}+it\right)=\sum_{n=1}^{m}\frac{1}{n^{\frac{1}{2}+it}}+ \chi\left(\tfrac{1}{2}+it\right)\sum_{n=1}^{m}\frac{1}{n^{\frac{1}{2}-it}}+O \left(t^{-1/4}\right).
